label: Business
text: Trump briefed on military and covert options for Iran, sources say. The US president also imposes a 25% tariff on countries that "do business" with Tehran, while Iran's foreign minister says his country is "ready for war".

label: Business
text: Former Fed chairs condemn criminal investigation into Jerome Powell. Three former heads of the central bank say the probe seeks to undermine the Fed's independence and "has no place" in the US.

label: Business
text: Trump warns of 'mess' ahead of legal ruling on tariffs. The Supreme Court's decision on Trump's trade strategy could come as soon as Wednesday.

label: Business
text: Faisal Islam: Trump faces extraordinary moment in spat with Fed chair. Jerome Powell's public response to a DoJ investigation could be a seismic moment for Donald Trump's presidency.

label: Business
text: X could 'lose right to self regulate', says Starmer. It is currently illegal to share deepfakes, but the law against creating them has not yet come into force.

label: Business
text: Why are more bosses sharing the top job?. More bosses are sharing the top job giving them more time for family and breaks.

label: Business
text: UK set for a 'booming' mortgage market, say analysts. Competition among lenders in the UK suggests that rates could be cut in the coming weeks.

label: Business
text: Heineken boss steps down as beer sales slow. The move to low and no-alcohol has led to falling sales at the brewing giant.

label: Business
text: Trump plan to cap credit card costs hits bank shares. The US president has called for interest rates on credit cards to be capped at 10% for one year.

label: Business
text: US justice department opens criminal probe into Fed chair. Jerome Powell said he believed the investigation was due to Donald Trump's anger over the Fed's refusal to cut interest rates.

label: Business
text: Instagram denies breach after many receive emails asking to reset password. The social media platform has said there was "no breach of its systems" but questions remain.

label: Business
text: Vets under corporate pressure to increase revenue, BBC told. Questions have been raised about whether the pet-care market is giving customers value for money.

label: Business
text: Google employee made redundant after reporting manager who showed nude of wife, court hears. Victoria Woodall claims she was retaliated against after reporting a manager who told clients stories about his swinger lifestyle.

label: Business
text: The FTSE 100 has hit a record high. Is now the time to start investing?. As the FTSE hits the 10,000 mark, the chancellor is encouraging more of us to become investors - but is it the right time?

label: Business
text: 'Out of stock': What went wrong at luxury retailer Saks?. Saks Global, which owns Saks Fifth Avenue and Neiman Marcus, is expected to imminently file for bankruptcy protection, leaving questions about the retailer's future.

label: Business
text: Potholes map rates council road repair progress. Thirteen local authorities received a "red rating" on the Department for Transport mapping tool for England.

label: Business
text: Malaysia and Indonesia block Musk's Grok over explicit deepfakes. Sexualised images of real people generated by Grok have circulated on X in recent weeks.

label: Business
text: 'Unprecedented' numbers seeking debt help post-Christmas, say charities. Debt charities say that calls have risen compared with last year as people are urged to seek help.

label: Business
text: Musk says X outcry is 'excuse for censorship'. The government is urging Ofcom to use all its powers – up to and including an effective ban – against X.

label: Business
text: Trump seeks $100bn for Venezuela oil, but Exxon boss says country 'uninvestable'. Oil executives expressed caution, with one executive saying Venezuela had seized their assets twice.

label: Business
text: EU reaches South America trade deal after 25 years of talks. Some farmers in Europe opposed the deal, but the EU Commission said it had listened to their concerns.

label: Business
text: Businesses call to be included in any pub rates backtrack. Shops, pharmacies and music venues want any climbdown on business rates for pubs to apply to them too.

label: Business
text: US calls Argentina peso bet a 'homerun deal'. The US Treasury Secretary said the US no longer held pesos in its exchange stabilisation fund.

label: Business
text: US job creation in 2025 slows to weakest since Covid. Employment growth for the world's largest economy eased significantly last year.

label: Business
text: Weight loss jabs affecting Greggs, boss says. The Greggs boss says there is "no doubt" weight loss jabs have led it to having a healthier menu.

label: Business
text: Ofcom urged to use 'banning' powers over X AI deepfakes. It follows an ongoing backlash against the use of X's AI Grok to digitally remove clothing from images.

label: Business
text: Inside the sub-zero lair of the world's most powerful computer. Faisal Islam gets rare access to Willow - Google's quantum computer.

label: Business
text: Why luxury carmakers are now building glitzy skyscrapers. Bugatti is the latest auto firm to construct an opulent apartment building for the super rich.

label: Business
text: 'I had no electricity for six months': US families struggle with soaring energy prices. Rising electricity costs have emerged as a key cost-of-living concern, pushing families further into debt.

label: Business
text: Excel: The software that's hard to quit. Companies are trying to wean staff off Excel spreadsheets to centralise control of their data.

label: Business
text: How tariff disruption will continue reshaping the global economy in 2026. Trump's import levies are still changing the patterns of international trade.

label: Business
text: How the new road safety measures could affect you. The government is proposing lowering alcohol limits for drivers and regular eye tests for older motorists.

label: Business
text: How the defence sector is battling a skills crisis. Attracting younger workers into the defence industry can be challenging.

label: Business
text: Swedish workers trial 'friendship hour' to combat loneliness. The pilot project is even giving staff free money to help pay to do activities with their friends.

label: Business
text: The showers and baths keeping data centre tech cool. Finding greener ways to keep giant new data centres cool is a challenge.

label: Business
text: Why Croatia's capital wants to hold Europe's best Christmas market. The festive events help to put cities on the map and attract millions of tourists.

label: Business
text: Will tech trump tradition at bakers and biscuit makers?. Introducing robots and automation to the food industry involves extra hurdles.

label: Business
text: Should more be done to tackle 'ghost jobs', vacancies that don't exist?. Companies are advertising vacancies that have already been filled or might not have ever existed.

label: Business
text: Why this month's inflation figure may be good news for you. The rate of inflation, which charts the rising cost of living, has slowed - driven partly by essentials.

label: Business
text: Meet the biggest heat pumps in the world. Across Europe huge heat pumps are being installed that can heat tens of thousands of homes.

label: Entertainment
text: Why Michael Sheen put his money on the line for new Welsh national theatre. The actor discusses spearheading the Welsh National Theatre and starring in its first production.

label: Entertainment
text: BBC will aim to have Trump's $5bn defamation lawsuit thrown out. Court papers filed on Monday show the broadcaster will argue the Florida court lacks "personal jurisdiction" over the BBC.

label: Entertainment
text: Chalamet beats DiCaprio to Golden Globes glory. The Marty Supreme star is among the big winners at the Globes and gets a boost in his quest for an Oscar.

label: Entertainment
text: Star glamour on the Golden Globes red carpet. Ariana Grande, Hailee Steinfeld and Paul Mescal were among the stars pictured ahead of the ceremony.

label: Entertainment
text: Golden Globes 2026: The full list of winners. The stars of Adolescence, including Stephen Graham, join Hollywood A-listers on the winners' podium.

label: Entertainment
text: First look at new crime drama starring Yellowstone actor. Sky's Under Salt Marsh has already been praised by critics before its release at the end of January.

label: Entertainment
text: Golden Globes top moments: Amy Poehler and Snoop Dogg to K-Pop triumphs. The annual award ceremony included plenty of star-power and banter, while bringing the Oscars race into focus.

label: Entertainment
text: Could Oscar glory be next for Jessie Buckley and Hamnet?. Jessie Buckley is a hot favourite to become the fifth Irish actor to win an Oscar after winning a Golden Globe.

label: Entertainment
text: 'My daughter helped shape new autistic Barbie doll'. An autism advocacy group describes the new toy as a "milestone" in representation.

label: Entertainment
text: Nigerian stars dominate All Africa Music Awards. Global superstar Burna Boy claimed the prestigious Album of the Year award for his latest work No Sign of Weakness.

label: Entertainment
text: EastEnders actor Derek Martin dies aged 92. Martin, a born and bred East Londoner, appeared as Charlie Slater between 2000 and 2016.

label: Entertainment
text: Lorraine Kelly pays tribute to father after 'shock' death. Lorraine Kelly has paid tribute to her 84-year-old father after his death in East Kilbride in Scotland.

label: Entertainment
text: Love Island villa evacuated and filming postponed over wildfires. Filming in South Africa for the third series of Love Island: All Stars has been postponed. ITV has not said when it will resume.

label: Entertainment
text: Bob Weir, Grateful Dead co-founder, dies aged 78. Weir was a fixture in the psychedelic rock group and its various spin-offs over 60 years.

label: Entertainment
text: KPop Demon Hunters wins Golden Globes for best animated film. The film's breakout anthem Golden was also named best original song at the awards on Sunday.

label: Entertainment
text: Stranger Things star is number one as show's songs shoot up chart. Joe Keery, aka musician Djo, aka Stranger Things' Steve Harrington, is number one in the UK charts.

label: Entertainment
text: Rare first Superman comic once stolen from Nicolas Cage sells for $15m. Fewer than 100 copies of Action Comics No 1, which introduced the world to Superman, are thought to exist.

label: Entertainment
text: Dwayne Johnson and George Clooney miss out on Baftas longlist. They are among big names missing out at the Baftas, which can often indicate who will win at the Oscars.

label: Entertainment
text: Sir Tom Jones says scammers impersonating him in fake profiles. The 85-year-old Welsh singer warns scammers are trying to "trap and abuse" vulnerable people.

label: Entertainment
text: US film stars Meagan Good and Jonathan Majors become Guinea citizens after DNA tests. The pair join other US celebrities reconnecting with their African heritage and taking up citizenship.

label: Entertainment
text: Golden Globes host Nikki Glaser's best jokes. The US comic delivered a scorching opening monologue that roasted the A-listers in the room.

label: Entertainment
text: How to watch the Golden Globe-nominated films. Hamnet, Avatar and Marty Supreme will face one battle after another as the awards race heats up.

label: Entertainment
text: Where does latest Traitors showdown rank in show's most explosive moments?. We look at whether the recent confrontation between two contestants on The Traitors goes down as the most dramatic ever.

label: Entertainment
text: How on the day Bowie died he apparently paid £10,116 towards a village car park. The cash was sent to Binley by Bowie's son, the total seemingly marking the date of the star's death.

label: Entertainment
text: Pierce Brosnan, Prince Naz and the embrace that never happened. When Prince Naseem Hamed met actor Pierce Brosnan in the lead-up to a new film, it brought back thoughts of a reconciliation with trainer Brendan Ingle that never happened.

label: Entertainment
text: Is a Welsh accent a help or a hindrance in The Traitors?. From hiding their jobs, to secret relationships and faking accents, many contestants have trialled strategies to gain people's trust.

label: Entertainment
text: Timothée's shoutout for Kylie and other moments from Critics' Choice Awards. Jessie Buckley won best actress and Adolescence also scooped four awards on the night in California.

label: Entertainment
text: Steve Coogan on his Roy Keane film - and his part in Posh and Becks' first meeting. Coogan stars as football boss Mick McCarthy in the film Saipan, about the fall-out between him and captain Roy Keane.

label: Entertainment
text: 'It's incredible, surreal': Skye Newman wins BBC Sound of 2026. Coming from a "broken background", Skye Newman's visceral, powerful pop has made her one to watch.

label: Entertainment
text: From trauma to triumph: Jim Legxacy is transforming UK rap. The south London rapper and producer's latest release has been called "a landmark moment for UK music".

label: Entertainment
text: The two sides of Sombr, the singer sparkling through the sadness. The alt-pop star comes third in the BBC Sound of 2026, which showcases the year's top rising stars.

label: Entertainment
text: How Geese took flight to become 'Gen Z's first great American band'. The New Yorkers, who are fourth in the BBC's Sound of 2026, say they're 'still processing' their rise.

label: Entertainment
text: Reluctant rockers Royel Otis tipped for success. The Australian indie pop duo had to be talked into becoming a band. It has more than paid off.

label: Entertainment
text: Sound of 2026: 10 acts you'll be obsessed with next year. The list tips new music for the coming year, following previous winners like Adele, Haim and Chappell Roan.

label: Health
text: Safe spaces needed for drug-addicted children, say grieving mums. More children in England are in drug and alcohol treatment, but families say many cannot get help.

label: Health
text: I spent months investigating whether gut health affects ageing - and if I could hack my own gut to age better. Health editor Hugh Pym revamped his diet after a test suggested his gut health appeared to look five years older than he was

label: Health
text: Revolutionary eye injection saved my sight, says first-ever patient. Nicki's eye had collapsed in on itself, but a new gel injection method has saved her vision.

label: Health
text: Why the NHS still wastes billions on patients who don't need to be in hospital. The delayed discharge challenge throws up deeper questions about the care system, co-ordination - and whether some patients are over-treated

label: Health
text: Doctors strike called off as union backs latest pay deal. Medics had been set to go on the first national walkout staged by NHS workers on Tuesday in a dispute over pay.

label: Health
text: Flu on the rise again after Christmas mixing, says NHS. Cases up after two weeks of decline, as hospitals report rise in slips and falls because of cold snap.

label: Health
text: People who come off slimming jabs regain weight four times faster than dieters. Overweight people shed large amounts on jabs but gain 0.8 kg a month on average once off them, study shows.

label: Health
text: How do cold weather health alerts work?. The weather alert service warns the public when high or low temperatures could damage their health.

label: Health
text: Vitamin pills and icy swims: Can you really boost your immune system?. After being struck down by winter illness, the BBC's James Gallagher goes in search of ways to boost his immune system.

label: Health
text: How to keep babies warm in cold weather and other winter tips. As temperatures fall across much of the UK, the best ways to keep people and pets warm and dry.

label: Health
text: What does an unheated room do to your body?. The BBC's health and science correspondent undergoes an experiment to find out how a cold home affects him.

label: Health
text: Flu: How are hospitals in your area affected?. Use our interactive tool to explore the latest flu numbers in your area

label: Health
text: What is happening to flu this winter - and should you buy a vaccine?. Flu has come early this year with a new mutated version of the virus circulating.

label: Health
text: Toddler finally home from hospital for Christmas. Bertie Melly was in hospital for 18 months after his premature birth in May 2024.

label: Health
text: Is it a cold, 'super flu' or Covid? How to tell the difference. How to identify whether you have cold, flu or Covid and how to look after yourself.

label: Health
text: Flu wave hits England's busiest A&E - hundreds of patients are arriving a day. The BBC visits Leicester Royal Infirmary to witness first-hand how it's coping with an early surge in cases of winter bugs.

label: Health
text: What's really going on with flu this winter?. We've been told we're facing an unprecedented superflu. Is it?

label: Health
text: Has flu peaked? What the figures tell us. NHS remains on high alert over flu, health bosses say, but there are signs infections are levelling off.

label: Health
text: Private flu vaccine stocks running low as cases rise. Those eligible for a vaccine can access jabs from the NHS, but experts say that people have turned to pharmacies for convenience.

label: Health
text: Ambulance demand spikes as flu season worsens. The service says calls increased by 20% in the past week, fuelled by illnesses such as the flu.

label: Health
text: Some schools disrupted amid rise in flu cases. Flu is on the rise, but ministers say schools should only close in extreme circumstances.

label: Health
text: Flu jabs offered in pub in vaccination drive. Regular pop-up vaccination clinics are available at The Bevy community pub in Brighton.

label: Health
text: Long waits for disability benefit claims unacceptable, MPs say. Some people are waiting more than a year to have their claims processed, the Public Accounts Committee says.

label: Health
text: Three NHS trusts still using fax machines, Streeting confesses. The health secretary had made it his personal mission to banish the fax machine from the NHS.

label: Health
text: Parents say babies failed by delayed diagnosis like Jesy Nelson's twins. After Little Mix star Jesy Nelson's revelation that her twins have SMA, parents speak about their children's late diagnoses.

label: Health
text: Junk food TV and online advert ban comes into force. Soft drinks, chocolate, pizzas and ice creams will be targeted in the UK government's plan.

label: Health
text: Wellbeing 2026: Recovery, JOMO and brain boosting supplements. Wellness is a multi-trillion pound industry which continues to grow - and this year is less about maxing out, more about recovering well.

label: Health
text: The myth of willpower - and why some people struggle to lose weight more than others. Thousands of genes that have an influence on weight, say experts - which means weight loss isn't a level playing field

label: Health
text: Chickenpox vaccines for young children start across UK. For the first time, children will be offered vaccination on the NHS against the common infection which, in rare cases, can be very serious.

label: Health
text: Surgeon who 'stripped naked in cubicle' struck off. The doctor was working at the Queen Alexandra Hospital in Portsmouth when the incidents happened.

label: Health
text: The debate about whether the NHS should use magic mushrooms to treat depression. Many clinical trials to test the use of psychedelic medicines for conditions such as depression have been underway since 2022 - with surprising results

label: Health
text: Christmas can be a nightmare for misophonia sufferers like me. Christmas is a difficult time if you suffer from a reduced tolerance to sounds, but there are ways to make it easier.

label: Health
text: Hospitals warned end-of-life care crisis threatening treatment. A rising number of patients in hospitals could affect the level of treatment carried out this winter, a group of regional NHS leaders have been told.

label: Health
text: Hospitals working to get patients home for Christmas after five-day doctor strike. Health experts have warned that the impact of the strike will be felt into the new year "and beyond".

label: Health
text: US regulator approves pill form of Wegovy weight-loss drug. Wegovy becomes first pill of its kind to be approved, shifting weight-loss drugs beyond injections.

label: Health
text: TikTok removes AI weight loss ads from fake Boots account. The adverts for prescription-only drugs showed healthcare professionals impersonating the British retailer.

label: Health
text: Weight-loss jabs: What happens when you stop?. You may have lost the weight you wanted to lose - but now you've stopped the jabs, how easy is it to keep it off?

label: Health
text: People fake weight to obtain 'skinny jabs', says GP. A doctor from Chelmsford calls for more checks to stop the drugs being sold inappropriately online.

label: Health
text: Nicotine pouch rise driven by young men - study. Around 7.5% of 16 to 24-year-old-men are using the small sachets that fit under the top lip, research suggests.

label: Health
text: Resident doctors in Scotland to go on strike for first time. Their union BMA Scotland has accused the government of reneging on a commitment to restore pay to 2008 levels.
